rComments: Lasar is a FANTASTIC lecturer! He has mastered the ability to speak in a way that sounds like he's telling a story, something that is so helpful when learning history (especially in a class in which the subject matter is so broad). I really enjoyed coming to class to listen to him speak. He engages with his students and pushes you to do better.
Professor Lasar is an amazing professor and an amazing lecturer. He assigned a book to read and a response to the book every other week. The textbook was somewhat useful.

Lasar is an overall good professor. He is obviously very well versed in the material and you can tell he genuinly takes interest in what he is teaching. He's also pretty funny in lecture. I'd reccomend taking a class from him.

The lectures were FANTASTIC. He's very knowledgeable and enthusiastic and you can really tell. He cares a lot about the subject and the students. On one occasion I asked for clarification on something after class and he wasn't sure, he actually went back and researched it and talked to me about it the next class.  Would recommend to everyone ever.

Excellent professor overall! He is kind of all over the place but that just makes the class all the more interesting. He has some great tips to better your writing because he has some tough expectations for writing but knowing what he expects makes it easier to write and your writing really improves.

Lasar was one of the most interesting teachers I've ever had. He's really passionate about what he teaches and incorporates what is going on in students' lives into the discussion and really asks us to pull from our own experiences. I personally did not take the class for the material, but it was something I looked forward to every week.
Lasar is awesome , he's hot, he's funny, what more could you ask for?? 3 3

Lasar knows his stuff, and he demands your respect and attention when you enter his lectures.  He's quite funny and eccentric in his often blunt views of certain political figure (particularly most of the US Presidents), but all in all he effectively covers a massive amount of material with ease.  Make sure you are there to hear everything he says.

History of the Cold War. Super enthusiastic about his lectures. Clearly demonstrates strong knowledge of the material. Strong use of textbook. Section attendance mandatory. 4 section papers (2pp), one term paper (8pp), midterm and final exam (essay question plus identifications). Overall, you will do as well in the course as you put into it.

Funny guy, good lecturer, interesting stuff. Just DO NOT take this class only to fulfill a ge. It is taught at a very slightly lower level than an upper division class, and the tests are brutal. Also, quote from first day: "If you fail to attend lecture, i may fail you depending on how i feel". Feels like a strict high school class.
this teacher is brutal. dont believe the other comments. i took a lower div for a ge and got destroyed with the amount of work he assigned. best of luck. dont take this class
Really awesome professor! Makes the material come to life!
Great Professor with an awesome attitude and clear (EASY) assignments.  Also very friendly and approachable. If people complain about him they are crazy.

I've had him for both the Global Cold War class and US History After WWII. Post WWII history was definitely a more compelling class (more social history and a less dry textbook). He's a great lecturer and certainly very knowledgable, but his ego often gets on my nerves. Either way, both classes are worth taking. Prepare to read a lot
intriguing lectures, but lots of reading
Great instructor, though the class is hard. His power points barely have anything on them. It was still worth it though because he's awesome.

Lasar is a fantastic teacher. Seriously, this guy is brilliant and such a good lecturer! I actually found myself looking forward to go to class just to hear what Lasar had to say. Hist 110F is one of the best classes I've taken at UCSC, and I'm not even a History major! If you get a chance, take a class with Lasar...you won't be disappointed!!
I graduated from UCSC a year ago and I'm considering going back to get my second BA just to take more Lasar classes.

EXCELLENT PROFESSOR! Knows his material, made me want to go to class even though lecture was not mandatory. I would highly recommend any of his classes, but prepare to do a lot of reading, it is interesting though!

Give this man a raise and have him teach these other people how college is supposed to be taught. Doesn't require attendance because his computer knowledge allows him to see that college is obsolete. One of the best classes I've taken at ucsc. Lazar is a god of UCSC.

I can't say enough good things about Lasar! THE best politics class i've taken. I never want to miss a lecture, and even wish this could be a year long class! Relevant. Engaging. It's a "you get what you put into it" kind of class. Five stars.
Lasar knows the material well but most importantly knows how to make it interesting. The man is a brilliant professor, engaging, approachable and highly entertaining.
Bald, cantankerous, and endlessly entertaining, Lasar is one hell of a lecturer. Except for his occasional lapses into ranting about the latest FCC news, I loved every second of the course.
Lasar routinely gives enthusiastic lectures. I enjoyed his classes so much that I never wanted to miss any. Also has a good sense of dry, sarcastic humor. He does indeed assign a lot of reading.

Lasar is an amazing and hilarious lecturer with a lot of great insights on American history. However, he also assigns a ton of reading. Not a bad thing, but be prepared to spend a lot of time on the readings if you take a class of his.
He is just like Larry David from Curb Your Enthusiasm but in a good way! He is a great teacher and is very entertaining.I really recommend him.

A good professor but he likes to use lectures to teach common sense life lessons instead of the class subject sometimes. While this isn't necessarily a bad thing, it can be a little frustrating dragging yourself out of bed to attend an hour and a half presentation on basic writing tips.

He is so cute. Kind of awkward in person, but witty and funny in class. He makes jokes about his age frequently, which makes his jokes a little funnier. I find it very hard to dislike him because he's so chill.

I understand there's some sort of Cult of Lasar on campus, but the hype leaves something to be desired.  I think his arrogance is too often mistaken for confidence.  Even as a fan of sarcasm I found his response to students' "dumb questions" as a little cruel. Not the worst prof ever, but I wouldn't go out of my way to take another class with him.

I don't get why history majors obsess over him..maybe it is because he is so easy. I didn't care for him. He wrote dumb and unfunny jokes into his lecture. He's too comfortable with the fact that most history majors love him. I did not learn one single new thing about history from him. That's the reality of his classes.
Lasar is very clear in his lectures, most of which are based around powerpoint. He like to integrate some current events and jokes into his lectures. The discussion wasn't too helpful though.

Possibly the best prof ever and an amazing lecturer.Very quirky and adds in crazy facts and tid bits into his lecture that you don't need to know about but make lectures enjoyable.I didn't get through a lecture without laughing. Mid term is easy if you're well prepared--he gives you the prompts before hand,so its you're job to be prepared, not his
Lasar is a great professor! Very interesting if you like the subject, and is pretty funny. Midterm is easy, you get the essay topics beforehand. Section is mandatory and TA's are usually very helpful

Lasar teaches very straight-forward.  Keeps the lectures interesting with his small jokes.  He shares his understandings of contemporary issues with class and keeps his class on its toes.  Overall, great guy and challenging course.
great teacher, material isn't amazing, but he always finds a way to hold my attention.
Really sarcastic, ok lecturer but gets pretty boring. The TA for this class was AWFUL!!!
Intelligent man and fantastic lecturer. Does his best to seem like a hard-ass but in reality is very caring, fair, and flexible. Heavy reading load, but tests mainly on lectures.
Great Techer, clear lectures, interesting material, and fun extra tidbits such as jokes and videos

very good speaker, especially when reading the text. he speaks loudly and clearly without those microphones so its pretty hard not to pay attention to him. throws out funny lines once in a while. liberal bias is true, but their mostly for laughs...i think. reading was typical of a history class(about 7 books).

Lasar is the type of man that tall-tales are made from. Don't let the shy smile he wears in his picture fool you, he has achieved a complete mastery of his subject. He is absolutely in his element in the classroom. The raw power of his voice is enough to chop down trees and scare away thunder.  Lasar's tears cure cancer, it's too bad he never cries

This man is my hero. I don't even take his class, I just sit outside his open door...longingly. That voice! That attitude! (Those opinions!) That winning personality! He's my dream teacher! Matthew Lasar should be president!

Lasar is a great professor and lecturer (more so when not lecturing on the main text). Good at throwing out interesting and important concepts that come up while not pushing an interpretationg on you. Let's you think for yourself. Although the main text comes from a fairly "people's"/leftist perspective the class is not limited to that.
Lasar is a gifted story teller which makes his lectures very interesting. Be prepared to read a great deal and never get up from you seat while he's talking, he will ask where you are going.

Lasar's lectures were always very well-organized and interesting.  there was a ton of reading, but after all it is an uppper-div... get used to it.  my ta, deeddra was really cool and a pretty tough grader.  lots of essays.  really good class.  makes everything come into full focus.

extremely interesting class. i do not have an interest in american history yet professor lasar's lectures make history somewhat interesting. he is often times unclear and unorganized in his lectures, but if the student puts forth an effort they are rewarded. WORD TO THE WISE: if you are not willing to read a lot of material do not take the class

Had this guy for 2 classes, upper div & lower.  Textbooks have leftist take on history, tons of reading.  His lectures are really quite good, he clearly has much experience and is comfortable working with young students unlike many proffessors.  He brings out the human experience in history.  Very approachable, bet he put his own pic on this site.

Funny guy, and he knows his stuff. I really liked his class and his teaching style. That said he has a MAJOR liberal bias, so take that into mind if that might piss you off. Also there are a lot of essays, but the grading is easy. Tests are straight forward and about general subjects. Overall a good class, and a good professor.

Good command of the subject, very energetic and admittedly 'exciting' lectures. However, he has a clearly liberal political slant and bias. Obviously each person is free to have their own opinions, but they should not carry over into the classroom and be preached to an essentially captive audience. Very disconcerting, to say the least.

Professor Lasar is an awesome educator! He is clear, concise, and to the point. He wants the students to grasp and understand history. He is passionate about his work, and I would recommend taking his class to anyone. You dont just have to be a history major to do well in his class. I am actually taking another one of his class cause he is awesome!

I've had Lasar for two History courses so far, and he might be my favorite professor at UCSC. He's very organized with clear lectures, tells hilarious jokes and stories, and lets you know what is to be expected on tests and papers. If you enjoy American History (and aren't upset by a bit of Liberal bias) definetly take a class with him.
No Comments

Lasar is cool. The guy who gave the luke-warm review was probably a republican. The paper prompts could be more thought provoking but the lectures make up for it. Highly recommended for some laughs. Funny guy. Easy grader, that wants students to learn more and not worry that much about grades.

Lasar was awesome! His lectures were informative and entertaining. His quizes and exams were tough but if you did the work you'd do fine. He's very passionate about what he teaches which is something I value in my professors.

Awesome class and awesome professor. Covered material clearly and in an interesting way. Readings were fairly interesting as well. My only gripe has to do with an idiot, mentally challenged TA that made me hate my life every time I went to section. Tests were challenging but fair; papers were easy.

well, I'm a Republican so I guess he was alright I often just put my head phones in and half listened. He has quite a personality his quizes are kind of hard but they were curved and tests were fair. I enjoyed the class especially sections. Sarah Doub is way tight, get her as a TA for sures.
this guy is awesome because when he's outside of lectures, he's always mumbling incoherently to himself.  god he loves history.  and blazing.  who cannot love blazing?

Excellent Professor. His lectures are very interesting, and his dry sense of humor make them enjoyable.  I would love to take another one of his classes, and would recommend him to anyone.  He assings lots of reading, but if you go to lecture, you don't have to do it.  I did that and still got an A.

What a wonderful professor. Lasar's lectures are engrossing, if sometimes quite challenging (he can speak quite fast). History with him is a giant, fascinating narrative. LOTS of reading, but I learned so much. Incredibly funny and witty, and cares a great deal about students. Highly recommended.

Matt is awesome! Some people feel differently depending on their majors but of the three years I have been attending this school, never has a teacher other then Lasar made me look forward to going to class. He talks a little fast and you need to pay attention, but he's so interesting you want listen

Lasar is cool. The guy who gave the luke-warm review was probably a republican. The paper prompts could be more thought provoking but the lectures make up for it. Highly recommended for some laughs. Funny guy.
he requires a lot of reading, but lectures on most of it in class, so it eases your load.  he really wants his students to enjoy his classes.
Easy grader. Really wants people to do well in his class.

He is the man! He knows everything and wants you to too. He has good reading, but a lot of it. His papers are fun and he doesn't grade them that hard. He has a study guide for the midterms and a class website. He is quirky, but funny, interesting, and smart.

Lasar has a great sacrastic sense of humor.  Easiest class I've taken.  Never does roll call and assigns papers that compare a book to a movie. very easy A. reading not necessary if you attend lectures.
terrible professor.  likes to leave out facts to try and make a point.  even caught him saying something questionable as a simple fact once.

Professor Lasar is quite possibly the best professor at UCSC. Ive taken 2 classes with him and i found him to be extremely intelligent, and easy to understand. + he takes perspectives on US history that others just wont touch.

Amazing. Intense about the subject matter, funny, totally on it. Knows his stuff- he doesn't just give the photocopied, standard version, and he's obviously thought a lot about the info he passes on.  Actually fairly aware of race, gender, and class- makes effort to incorporate.
He was a great sarcastic and witty teacher who used a lot of helpful powerpoint slides. I really enjoyed his classes and his media presentations. It was a great class.

He's funny, has a great accent, and livens it up by talkin' loud and giving some interesting detail to set the mood of the period you're studying. People may say he gives too much work, but he doesn't. Reading and Midterms are pretty lax.

Lasar is the best teacher I have ever had.  His class takes a lot of work (A LOT of reading), but it is all interesting and his lectures are fantastic.  You'll get an A if you pay attention and do your work.  There are no tricks.
He's a great guy.  He basically has insight on everything, practically never has to look in a book for factual questions and is quite comical.  Arguably one of the best teachers I have ever had.
Had him twice- great professor.  His lectures are very entertaining.  Tests are straight from the readings, which he covers in his lectures.  Usually he assigns one paper.
Matt is an awesome professor, he's simply clear, articulate, and occasionally quite comical.
Super nice guy and very clear lecture style. Knows everything, basically.
